main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by military personnel at Kirtland AFB on multiple occasions in March 1950, with descriptions of it moving at high speeds and exhibiting unusual maneuvers.
interesting points: The object was first spotted by control tower operators and reported to Air Intelligence immediately., It was described as having a metallic appearance and being somewhat saucer-shaped., Radar did not detect the phenomenon despite it being within radar coverage., Over 500 plastic pieces from a burst Skyhook balloon were mistaken for flying saucers in a separate incident., Witnesses were experienced and familiar with aircraft, ruling out conventional aerial targets.
sighted object: unidentified flying object, described as metallic and saucer-shaped
witness description: military personnel, including officers and enlisted men
